clinical_study.brief_title: Culturally Modified Family Based Therapy for Haitian Youth in South Florida
clinical_study.official_title: Culturally Modified Family Based Therapy for Haitian Youth in South Florida

brief_summary.textblock: The Culturally Modified Family Based Therapy for Haitian Youth and Their Families in South Florida study is a unique intervention that will develop and implement a culturally-specific, integrated family and individual-based, drug use, sexual risk and delinquency risk reduction program for Haitian youth ages 13-17 in Miami-Dade County, Florida.

detailed_description.textblock: Haitian youth in Miami-Dade County who become part of the juvenile justice system have not received culturally appropriate remediating or rehabilitative attention by that system. This study will modify a specific variety of intervention, the Culturally Informed and Flexible Family-Based Treatment for Adolescents (CIFFTA) for appropriateness in Miami's Haitian cultural contexts. This study will develop and implement a culturally specific, integrated family and individual-based, drug use, sexual risk and delinquency risk reduction program for Haitian adolescents aged 13-17 in Miami-Dade County, Florida.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants that completes the intervention
primary_outcome.description: All the participants that complete the modules and the baseline instruments

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with sustained abstinence in substance use as assessed by biochemical verification
primary_outcome.description: Participants maintain a sustained abstinence measured through biochemical verification via urine drug test.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with sustained abstinence in substance use as assessed by self-reporting
primary_outcome.description: Participants maintain a sustained abstinence measured through self-reporting

primary_outcome.measure: Change in family functioning assessed by the family environment scale (FES)
primary_outcome.description: Improved connectivity and communication within the family system will be assess via the FES questionnaire with scales ranging from 0-26 with the highest score indicating that no further intervention is needed

primary_outcome.measure: Change in conduct disorder as assess by Revised Behavior Problem Checklists
primary_outcome.description: Improvement in conduct disorder as assess in Revised Behavior Problem Checklists (RBPC) evaluating the severity of disorderly behavior with scales ranging from 0 to 2 (0=no problem; 1=mild problem; 2=severe problems)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in sexual risk behaviors as assess by the Comprehensive Adolescent Severity Inventory (CASI)
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in risky sexual activities as assess by CASI using normative data-severity scores range from 0 (never) to 3 (very often)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with recidivism in delinquency
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants that have no report of arrests from the Juvenile Services Department

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in family communication as assessed by Parenting Style Questionnaire (PSQ)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in family communication as assessed by Parenting Style Questionnaire (PSQ) with scoring ranges from 1 to 7 where 7 indicates optimum communication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with peer gang involvement
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with peer gang involvement self-reported

arm_group.description: Family Therapy, Individual Therapy, and Psycho-educational Modules
The Diversion Programs used by the Juvenile Services Department in Miami-Dade.

intervention.intervention_name: Haitian youth and family intervention study: family functioning
intervention.description: A weekly group therapy with the youth, the parents and other members of the family.

intervention.intervention_name: Haitian youth intervention study: youth psychoeducational
intervention.description: Weekly one and one psychoeducational module will be delivered to the youth.

intervention.intervention_name: Haitian family intervention study: family psychoeducational
intervention.description: Weekly psychoeducational module will be delivered to the family.
Youth will attend individual psychological counselling at an assigned Juvenile Services Department (JSD) diversion program.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria :
- Adolescents aged 13 to 17 and their families
- Place of residence is Miami-Dade
- Has Haitian ancestry
- Adolescents not incarcerated
- No prior mental health care or history of psychoactive medication
- Adolescents in families who have lived in the US for 3 years
- Families with a range of organizational structure (nuclear and non-nuclear)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Youths with a documented history of mental retardation and/or organic dysfunction.
